task.title: Creating Schema Languages in Oxygen
task.shortdesc: Follow these steps to create a DTD schema language in Oxygen XML Editor

taskbody.prereq: You must have a licensed version of Oxygen XML editor to complete this task

context.p: XML, which stands for Extensible Markup Language, is a markup language that is designed to carry data. An XML DTD, or document type definition, is used to define your XML document's structure with a list of legal elements. In creating a DTD, you are creating rules that govern your XML file structure. Knowing how to create an XML DTD will ensure your XML file validity and proper functioning.

step.cmd: Purchase Oxygen XML editing software program.
Install your DTD editor.
Restart your computer, if necessary.
Familiarize yourself with your DTD editor's workspace, as well as with any user guides or support materials that accompany your DTD editor.
Create a new project that will contain the DTD.
Save your file.
step.info: The file name must end with ".dtd."

step.cmd: Declare elements with an element declaration.
step.info: Elements are the building blocks of your XML document.

step.cmd: Declare attributes with an attribute declaration. Attributes provide additional information about the elements in your XML document.
Add entities where necessary.
Add notations and comments as necessary.
Check for errors by reviewing your work thoroughly.
Correct any errors you identify.
Save your work.
Validate your XML DTD using Oxygen editor's validation tool.
Correct any errors detected during validation.
Save your work.
Open the XML file for which you have created the DTD.
If the DTD is internal, declare so using the proper syntax.
If the DTD is external, declare so using the proper syntax.
Save your XML file.
